vague_description: The store needs to optimize staffing costs while adhering to constraints related to labor composition and budget limits.
detailed_description: A store employs senior citizens who earn \var{WageSenior} per week and young adults who earn \var{WageYoung} per week. The store must keep the weekly wage bill below \var{MaxWageBill}. On any day, the store requires at least \var{MinWorkers} workers, of whom at least \var{MinYoung} must be young adults. To ensure the store runs smoothly, the number of young adults should be at least \var{YoungToSeniorRatio} the number of senior citizens. Formulate a LP to minimize the wage bill.
target_constraints: Total weekly wage must not exceed MaxWageBill
Each day at least MinWorkers must be on duty
Each day at least MinYoung must be young adults
Young adults must be at least YoungToSeniorRatio times the number of senior citizens
Number of senior citizens is non-negative
Number of young adults is non-negative
Number of senior citizens is an integer
Number of young adults is an integer
target_parameters: Wage for senior citizens per week
Wage for young adults per week
Minimum number of workers required per day
Minimum number of young adults required per day
Minimum fraction of young adults relative to senior citizens
